senses.de: Work together on a task or project
senses.ex: We will collaborate on the presentation next week

Tips.title: Positive Undertone
Tips.description: 'Collaborate' suggests a willingly shared effort and is usually seen as positive.
Tips.example: They are excited to collaborate on the new marketing strategy.

Tips.title: Professional Context
Tips.description: 'Collaborate' is often used in professional or academic settings, indicating teamwork.
Tips.example: The departments will collaborate to improve the software.

Tips.title: Voluntary Participation
Tips.description: Using 'collaborate' means the people involved have chosen to work together.
Tips.example: The artists chose to collaborate on a masterpiece.

senses.de: Help the enemy against one's own country during war
senses.ex: He was suspected of collaborating with the enemy

Tips.title: Negative Connotation
Tips.description: 'Collaborate' in this context has a negative meaning, implying betrayal.
Tips.example: The officer was dishonorably discharged for collaborating with the enemy.

Tips.title: Wartime Context
Tips.description: This sense of 'collaborate' is typically used during discussions of war or conflict.
Tips.example: During the war, some citizens were forced to collaborate with the invaders.

Tips.title: Treason Implication
Tips.description: 'Collaborate' here may suggest committing treason, which is a serious crime.
Tips.example: He was accused of collaborating and faced severe consequences.

senses.de: Work together for a common goal in the fields of art, science, or business
senses.ex: The two authors collaborated on a book

Tips.title: Creative Synergy
Tips.description: 'Collaborate' here emphasizes the joining of creative or intellectual efforts.
Tips.example: The musicians collaborated to fuse jazz and classical music.

Tips.title: Cross-Field Projects
Tips.description: 'Collaborate' can mean bringing together expertise from different fields.
Tips.example: A physicist and a biologist collaborated on a research paper.

Tips.title: Equality in Participation
Tips.description: Participants are generally seen as equals when they collaborate in such contexts.
Tips.example: The co-authors collaborated, each contributing equally to the book.

Contribute.wordDefinition:
Contribute means to give something towards a project or task. This implies that the work is being done individually and that each person is making their own contribution to the overall effort.

Contribute is often used in situations where an individual is expected to make their own contribution to a larger effort, such as donating money to a charitable cause or writing a chapter for a collaborative book.

Cooperate.wordDefinition:
Collaborate and cooperate are two similar words that have a slightly different meaning. To collaborate means to work together with someone or a group of people to accomplish a specific goal or project.

To cooperate means to work together with someone or a group of people to achieve a common goal, but without necessarily sharing ideas or resources.

Cooperation is more about coordinating individual efforts towards a common objective, without necessarily requiring a high level of communication or interaction between the parties involved.

Both collaboration and cooperation are essential in many different contexts, such as business, education, and social settings.

However, collaboration is often more effective when working on complex or innovative projects that require a high degree of creativity and teamwork, while cooperation is more applicable for routine tasks or activities that require minimal interaction between people.

Coordinate.wordDefinition:
Coordinate means to organize or arrange things or people to work together towards a goal. It focuses more on the logistics of making sure that the right people are in the right place at the right time.

Coordination is applicable when people need to work together, but their roles are more defined and there is less need for active collaboration.

In summary, collaboration is about actively working together towards a shared goal, while coordination is about organizing and arranging people and resources to work towards a goal.

Team up.wordDefinition:
The words collaborate and team up mean working together, but collaborate usually implies working together on a project where each person contributes their own unique skills and ideas to the end goal.

Team up usually implies two or more people working together to achieve a common goal but may not necessarily involve different skill sets.

If someone says "let's team up to clean the house," it means that two or more people will work together to complete a common task without necessarily needing different areas of expertise.

Unite.wordDefinition:
Collaborate means working together on a project or goal, while unite means joining together or becoming one.

A country may unite in times of crisis or war to stand together against a common enemy.

Both words involve working together, but collaborate is more focused on a specific task or project, while unite is about joining together as a whole.

quotes.Text: I wasn't really actively trying to pursue music, so I was really just allowed to create freely without any pressure or outside influences like, 'Oh, I should be making this' or 'I should be collaborating with this person.' It was just kind of like whatever I wanted to do. I was just having fun with it.
quotes.Title: American Rapper
quotes.Name: Goldlink

quotes.Text: I would not necessarily say that scientists and artists need to collaborate with one another, but it would be helpful for them to talk to one another to, perhaps, give rise to specific ideas that may or may not be carried out together.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Eric Kandel

quotes.Text: I love the process - collaborating with the photographers, traveling, and seeing different cultures. My mother always said I would regret it if I didn't do it. And I think she was right.
quotes.Title: Danish Model
quotes.Name: Freja Beha Erichsen

quotes.Text: I pride myself in collaborating and being a creative director, and creative direction isn't putting my opinion first. It's supporting an artist so they get the most out of the project.
quotes.Title: American Designer
quotes.Name: Virgil Abloh

quotes.Text: Sincere and generous collaboration is the best way to fulfil the legitimate aspirations of each person and achieve great collective goals for the common good and the general interest.
quotes.Title: Spanish Royalty
quotes.Name: Felipe VI of Spain

quotes.Text: I am paid to dive deeper into my own humanity and do that with other people in collaboration... so that, in and of itself, I just feel like is the greatest privilege in the world.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Gaby Hoffmann

quotes.Text: NEPA's common sense approach to foster discussion and collaboration about major development projects has worked well to protect our national treasures and resources.
quotes.Title: American Activist
quotes.Name: Frances Beinecke

quotes.Text: Like life, peace begins with women. We are the first to forge lines of alliance and collaboration across conflict divides.
quotes.Title: Iraqi Activist
quotes.Name: Zainab Salbi

quotes.Text: I wanted to collaborate with someone, but it had to be someone I could work with and who wouldn't disrespect my past.
quotes.Title: British Musician
quotes.Name: George Harrison
